name: Python Basics
description: Python is the most popular programming language in cloud engineering. Work through Python Crash Course chapter by chapter to build a solid foundation.

learning_steps.title: Python Crash Course, 3rd Edition
learning_steps.description: Purchase or borrow Python Crash Course by Eric Matthes. We'll work through Part I (chapters 1-11), which covers all the Python fundamentals you need.

learning_steps.title: Getting Started
learning_steps.description: Set up your Python environment, install VS Code, and write your first 'Hello World' program.

learning_steps.text: Chapter 2: Variables and Simple Data Types
learning_steps.title: Variables and Simple Data Types
learning_steps.description: Learn about variables, strings, integers, and floats. Free sample chapter available!

learning_steps.title: Introducing Lists
learning_steps.description: Create lists, access elements by index, and use methods like append, insert, and remove.

learning_steps.title: Working with Lists
learning_steps.description: Master for loops, list comprehensions, slicing, and tuples.

learning_steps.title: if Statements
learning_steps.description: Learn conditional logic: if, elif, else, and boolean expressions.

learning_steps.title: Dictionaries
learning_steps.description: Understand key-value pairs—essential for working with JSON and APIs.

learning_steps.text: Chapter 7: User Input and while Loops
learning_steps.title: User Input and while Loops
learning_steps.description: Accept user input and control program flow with while loops.

learning_steps.title: Functions
learning_steps.description: Define functions, pass arguments, and return values. The building blocks of clean code.

learning_steps.title: Classes
learning_steps.description: Introduction to object-oriented programming: classes, instances, attributes, and methods.

learning_steps.title: Files and Exceptions
learning_steps.description: Read and write files, handle errors gracefully with try/except.

learning_steps.title: Testing Your Code
learning_steps.description: Write tests with pytest—a professional skill that catches bugs early.

learning_steps.title: CS50 Lecture on Python
learning_steps.description: Harvard's CS50 lecture on Python. Everything should make sense—if not, revisit the relevant chapters.

questions.prompt: How would you explain the difference between a list and a dictionary to a junior developer, and when would you choose each?
Walk me through exception handling in Python and why try/except is important for production code.

test_knowledge_prompts: Can you quiz me on lists vs dictionaries?
Can you ask me about exception handling?
